result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen K Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443

Per Standing Order Defendant to pay $10 Drug Offender Diversion Surcharge

The total of Counts #1 and #2 is to be paid in $25 per month installments commencing on 8/29/16 and on the 29th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 17  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--On Count #1: serve 20  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karen K Mueller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Refer Debt to the WI Dept of Revenue, along with supporting Reminder Notices.
Duplicate original warrant received from JESO - Serving time

Cases 16CM129 and 15CT527 called together at 2:26pm
Defendant Karen K Mueller in court, in custody with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Case 15CT527 and Counts #1 and #2 of Case 16CM129; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining counts
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

As to Case 16CM129:
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--On Count #1: serve 20  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--0 days credit for time already served given

On Count #1: 
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443

On Count #2:
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443

The total of Counts #1 and #2 is to be paid in $25 per month installments commencing on 8/29/16 and on the 29th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 17  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive


As to Case 15CT527:
--To serve  25 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to the sentence in Case 16CM129
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days


--To pay fine of $350+ costs= $1379, to be paid in installments of $25 per month, to begin at the conclusion of the payment plan in case 16CM129, non payment shall result in 26 days in the Jefferson County Jail with work release/Huber, consecutive 
--Revocation of drivers license for 12 months
--AODA assessment
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 12 month period  

--6 demerit points assessed

recess: 2:52pm
Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2016 at 10:20 am.
Status conference on June 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 16CM129, 15CM417, 15CM277, and 15CT527 called together at 10:19am [mo]
Defendant Karen K Mueller in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 16CM129(Initial Appearance occurs)
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
No demand for speedy trial

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of Case 16CM129 and 15CT527

As to Cases 15CM277 and 15CM417:
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Cases 15CM277 and 15CM417; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Cases 15CM277 and 15CM417, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

The Court orders all the conditions as outlined in the Criminal Case Settlement.

[which are:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/ or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription 
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--provide agent with a list of all current prescriptions and dosages from treating physician(s)
--no operation of any motor vehicle without express agent approval and valid drivers license
--no contact with any known drug offender, except for treatment purposes per Agent
--to submit DNA sample 
--to pay statutory costs]

The Court distributes its scheduling order for case 15CT527

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 10:50am
NEXT: As to Case 16CM129: (1)DA PTC on 4/20/16 at 10:20am (2)STC on 6/13/16 at 2:00pm
            As to Case 15CT527: (1)FSSC on 6/13/16 at 2:00pm (2)Jury Trial on 6/16/16 at 8:30am (one day trial)
